alert.note: Alert for Amite; Hancock; Harrison; Jackson; Pearl River; Pike; Walthall; Wilkinson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 26 at 8:33PM CDT until August 27 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING FOR CRITICAL FIRE CONDITIONS IN SOUTH MISSISSIPPI AND PORTIONS OF SOUTHEAST LOUISIANA... .In coordination with state and federal fire weather officials, a red flag warning has been issued for tomorrow due to a combination of the moderate to severe drought across the area, extreme temperatures, minimum relative humidity values below 35%, and area wide burn bans. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 8 PM CDT SUNDAY FOR CRITICAL FIRE CONDITIONS FOR SOUTH AND COASTAL MISSISSIPPI AND PORTIONS OF SOUTHEAST LOUISIANA... * AFFECTED AREA...Pointe Coupee, West Feliciana, East Feliciana, St. Helena, Washington, Iberville, West Baton Rouge, East Baton Rouge, Assumption, St. James, St. John The Baptist, Wilkinson, Amite, Pike, Northern Tangipahoa, Walthall, Southeast St. Tammany, Pearl River, Northern St. Tammany, Southwestern St. Tammany, Hancock, Central Tangipahoa, Harrison, Lower Tangipahoa, Jackson, Northern Livingston, Southern Livingston, Western Ascension and Eastern Ascension. * WINDS...Northwest 5 to 10 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 32 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. A Burn Ban is already in place for all areas.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Amite; Hancock; Harrison; Jackson; Pearl River; Pike; Walthall; Wilkinson
